description: A site destroyed by quarrying in the 18th and 19th CE, interpreted as a religious enclosure, possibly a temple based on the votive material was saved from the site.
bibliography: Denford. “Some Exotic Discoveries at Silkstead Sandpit, Otterbourne, and the Possible Site of an Ancient Temple.” Proceedings of the Hampshire Field Club and Archaeological Society 48 (1993).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Silkstead Sandpit, Otterbourne (Hampshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
